verses.roman:
āra eka gopī-premera svābhāvika cihna
ye prakāre haya prema kāma-gandha-hīna

synonyms: āra—another; eka—one; gopī-premera—of the love of the gopīs; svābhāvika—natural; cihna—symptom; ye—which; prakāre—in the way; haya—is; prema—the love; kāma-gandha-hīna—without a trace of lust.
translation: There is another natural symptom of the gopīs' love that shows it to be without a trace of lust.
